Class AbstractGraph

java.lang.Object
AbstractGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph
Direct Known Subclasses:
ListGraph, MatrixGraph
public abstract class AbstractGraph extends Object implements Graph
Abstract base class for graphs. A graph is a set of vertices and a set of edges. Vertices are represented by integers from 0 to n - 1. Edges are ordered pairs of vertices.

    • loadEdgesFromFile

      public void loadEdgesFromFile​(Scanner scan)
      Load the edges of a graph from the data in an input file. The file should contain a series of lines, each line with two or three data values. The first is the source, the second is the destination, and the optional third is the weight.
      Parameters:
      scan - The Scanner connected to the data file

    • createGraph

      public static Graph createGraph​(boolean isDirected, String type) throws IOException
      Create a graph without a specified scanner, using a JFileChooser to pick out a graph
      Parameters:
      isDirected - true if the Graph is to be a directed graph
      type - Flag for whether the graph is implemented with an adjacency list or an adjacency matrix
      Returns:
      A graph from the user's chosen file
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is neither "Matrix" nor "List"
      IOException

    • createGraph

      public static Graph createGraph​(Scanner scan, boolean isDirected, String type) throws IOException
      Factory method to create a graph and load the data from an input file. The first line of the input file should contain the number of vertices. The remaining lines should contain the edge data as described in loadEdgesFromFile.
      Parameters:
      scan - The scanner connected to the data file
      isDirected - true if this is a directed graph, false otherwise
      type - The string "Matrix" if an adjacency matrix is to be created, and the string "List" if an adjacency list is to be created.
      Returns:
      The Graph from the data file
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is neither "Matrix" nor "List"
      IOException
